title: The Swapped Name Plates
setting: Meridian Architecture Firm, executive floor, Monday 8 AM
premise: Every name plate on the executive floor was swapped around over the weekend, causing chaos Monday morning. The custom brass plates are bolted on and require a specific hex wrench to remove.

suspects.name: Lloyd Patterson
suspects.motive: Was publicly humiliated by a partner for a drafting mistake at Friday's review
suspects.alibi: I spent the whole weekend at a design competition at the university. Registration was at 8 AM Saturday and the awards ceremony was Sunday at 5 PM. My team placed second.

suspects.name: Vera Costa
suspects.motive: Denied a transfer to the creative team despite applying four times
suspects.alibi: I was at my cousin's wedding Saturday afternoon and the reception went until midnight. Sunday I recovered at home all day. I didn't go anywhere near the office.

suspects.name: Neil Chambers
suspects.motive: His overtime was cut and he blames the executive partners for being cheap
suspects.alibi: I came in Sunday morning at 8 AM to fix a leaking pipe in the basement. I was in the basement from 8 AM to noon. I left after that and went home.

suspects.name: Irene Walsh
suspects.motive: Passed over for a promotion in favor of an external hire with less experience
suspects.alibi: I worked from home all weekend on a deadline project. I submitted my drawings electronically at 3 PM Sunday. My file timestamps will show I was working consistently.

clues.title: Tool Check
clues.content: The specific hex wrench needed for the name plates is kept in the maintenance closet. The closet's sign-out sheet shows Neil checked out tools Sunday at 8:10 AM and returned them at 11:50 AM.

clues.title: Building Security Footage
clues.content: Security footage shows Neil entering the basement at 8:15 AM Sunday and not exiting until 11:45 AM. The executive floor camera shows someone at the name plates at 10 PM Saturday night.

clues.title: Wedding Venue Check
clues.content: The wedding venue confirms Vera's cousin's reception ended at 10 PM Saturday, not midnight as Vera claimed. Guests were cleared out by 10:15 PM per the venue's strict policy.

hints.text: The name plates were swapped Saturday night — consider who was actually free at that time.
When exactly did that wedding reception end — does the claimed timeline match the venue's rules?
